unnormalised: **Telecoms See Uptick in Data Plan Upgrades Driven by OTT Growth**
normalised: **Telecoms See Uptick in Data Plan Upgrades Driven by O T T Growth**

unnormalised: New Delhi – Indian telecom operators are reporting a significant increase in data plan upgrades, attributed to the burgeoning popularity of Over-The-Top (OTT) platforms and increased mobile video consumption. A recent report by the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) highlights a 25% year-on-year growth in mobile data usage.
normalised: New Delhi – Indian telecom operators are reporting a significant increase in data plan upgrades, attributed to the burgeoning popularity of Over-The-Top (O T T) platforms and increased mobile video consumption. A recent report by the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (T R A I) highlights a twenty five percent year-on-year growth in mobile data usage.

unnormalised: "The appetite for data is insatiable, much like Gabbar Singh's thirst for revenge in Sholay," quipped Mr. Sharma, Head of Research at IIM Bangalore, commenting on the trend. He further added that users are increasingly opting for plans offering upwards of 2 GB per day to stream content from platforms like Hotstar and JioCinema.

unnormalised: Airtel and Jio are currently offering competitive data plans, with prices starting from Rs. 299 for 1.5 GB per day to Rs. 699 for plans offering 3 GB per day with bundled OTT subscriptions. Experts predict this trend will continue, pushing telecom companies to innovate and offer more value-added services within their data plans. Rural areas are also witnessing a slow but steady increase in data consumption, driven by affordable smartphones and expanding network coverage beyond metros.
